intro: Brassica strigosa, commonly known as rough mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, containing a high amount of glucosinolates. Brassica strigosa is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
